cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.DM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of testing monotonicity of Boolean functions, which is a fundamental problem in computational complexity theory. The paper uses techniques from computational complexity, probability theory, and information theory. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The paper also involves the analysis of randomized algorithms, which suggests that it could be categorized under cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) as well. The paper also uses information-theoretic tools to analyze the problem, which suggests that it could be categorized under cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper deals with the analysis of Boolean functions, which suggests that it could be categorized under cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) as well. Finally, the paper deals with the analysis of randomized algorithms for testing properties of Boolean functions, which suggests that it could be categorized under cs.LG (Machine Learning) as well.
